title: About
text:
I attended the United World College Red Cross Nordic (UWCRCN), located in Flekke, Norway. UWC makes education a force to unite people, nations and cultures for peace and a sustainable future.
While in Norway, I studied the International Baccalaureate (IB), taking Global Politics HL, Spanish Literature HL, English B HL, French ab initio SL, Math Analysis and Approaches SL, and Physics SL. During my time there, I also enjoyed hiking and diving, and experienced personal, academic, and spiritual growth.

title: About

At Macalester, Iâ€™m pursuing a double major in Economics and Statistics, along with a minor in French.
As of now, Iâ€™ve served as a Teaching Assistant (TA) for Applied Multivariable Calculus II and Introduction to Statistical Modeling. This upcoming semester, Fall 2025, I will be the TA for Intermediate Macroeconomics, and Machine Learning. As you may have perceived, I love teaching!
My research interests focus primarily on development economics, immigration, and labor market inequalities. My research for my Econometrics class analyzed wage disparities among immigrant workers, emphasizing intersections of gender and citizenship.
Additionally, Iâ€™ve participated in research and training programs such as the Expanding Diversity in Economics (EDE) Program at the University of Chicago in the Summer of 2024 and the Mathematical Modeling and Public Health Workshop at Harvard Chan School in March 2025.
You can find me exploring extreme sports, cooking, or watching movies when Iâ€™m not diving into research or crunching numbers.

title: David Rios
text: Hi, my name is Hermogenes David Riosâ€”Hermogenes is my first name, David is my middle name, and Rios is my last name. My first name comes from a family tradition: itâ€™s passed down to the first-born child of each generation. So, yepâ€”thatâ€™s me! Iâ€™m from Bolivia and am currently studying in the U.S. at Macalester College in Saint Paul, Minnesota. Learn more about me and my work.
